greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Let p(n) be the n-th prime congruent to 1 mod 4. Then a(n) = the least m for which m^2+1=p(n)*k^2 has a solution.
mathematica: f[n_] := Block[{y = 1}, While[ !IntegerQ[ Sqrt[n*y^2 - 1]], y++ ]; Sqrt[n*y^2 - 1]]; lst = {}; Do[p = Prime@ n; If[ Mod[p, 4] == 1, AppendTo[lst, f@p]; Print[{n, Prime@n, f@p}]], {n, 66}]; lst
program: a094048 n = head [m | m <- map (a037213 . subtract 1 . (* a002144 n))
results.author: _Matthijs Coster_, Apr 29 2004
